  lead to health and success!
quote: "You become what you believe." Oprah Winfrey

step_of_the_day.title:
Belief is very powerful. Use it today to support your resilience and success. Create a positive, supportive
  belief today (Pillar #5 and all the rest)
step_of_the_day.content:
I'm reminded of the history of breaking the "4-minute mile." For years, so many athletes had tried and
  failed to run a mile in less than four minutes that people believed it was a physical impossibility. In
  fact, even scientists weighted in to say it couldn't be done. The world record was 4 minutes and 1.3
  seconds, set by Gunder Hagg of Sweden in 1945.Then in May of 1954 under less-than-ideal conditions, Roger Bannister, a British medical student ran the
  mile in 3 minutes and 59.4 seconds. With the mystique broken, 8 other athletes broke the 4-minute mile
  within the year. Today, over 1,400 athletes have broken this mark!What does this say about the power of belief? What does this say about how your beliefs shape your life,
  your achievements and your success? Beliefs open doors and break down barriers to achievements.

action_step:
Today, identify one of your beliefs that holds you back. One way that you believe you can't, believe it will
  be difficult, believe some barrier will get in your way? And reframe this by thinking how it's possible, how
  it can be done and how you will give 100% to achieve it.
journal_entry: Write about your own beliefs and how they either support you or get in your way.
